content:
Posted: February 6
Product received for free
Note: I received this game for free from a friend. However, it will not affect my view in any way.--Positive--Fast and UnforgivingKilling enemies is quick, dying is quick, movement is quick, the whole game has a constant reliance on fast-paced gameplay.Character varietyThere's a lot to choose from right at the start. Each character has their own abilities, look, sounds, loading screen tips and more.Weapon varietyThough not as varied as, say, Enter the Gungeon, you'll still have lots of fun finding all sorts of new weapons to rain bullets and explosions on your enemies.--Neutral--Pixel artstyleI personally think it fits the game well but others may not be so keen on it's retro look.--Negative--Difficulty spikeThe game very suddenly throws an incredibly challenging boss at you on level 5 - 3, and it only gets worse from there.30 FPS lockIt would seem devastating for a game like this to have a FPS lock under 60, but in my opinion the game is still fine with it. 60 FPS would definitely make it more enjoyable, but unfortunately the lock is tied with the engine so the devs would need to remake the game from scratch to hit it.Fast and UnforgivingYep, a double-edged sword. The crazy difficulty could keep players away as much as it could make masochists want to overcome the challenge more.Overall, i'd give this game a shot. It is a lot of fun and I really hope Vlambeer will make a sequel/spirtual successor to it.

Early Access Review
								I have to say that Nuclear Throne is a very fun game and has a nice challenge to it, but at certain parts it seems that the challenge/skill curve is very steep, and it is somewhat of a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥when the dungeons sometimes have enough XP to level you up, where as other playthroughs barely give you enough to get halfway to the next level. Apart from that, my only other complaint is that it could use a mechanic where Chicken is able to regain his head and the player gets like half health every time they die (in a level) rather than running around headless and hoping that God favors you and lets one of the mobs drop a health pack for you to revive with. All in all; an amazing game even this early on, can't wait to see what the finished product looks like and what new characters/elements the bring in.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Crazy good game. Fast, harsh, brutal, unadulterated and randomly-generated glee/rage/fun. Cannot recommend highly enough. THIS is the game that you put up on a projector and throw a party with. Tons of variety and content, (especially for a beta!) and it's only getting better as time goes. Some of my favorite highlights/features/doohickies include.;- ASPLOSIONS. Lots of 'em. Asplodey-ness is not lacking here. Cars explode, enemies explode, barrels explode, grenades and rockets and sticky bombs all explode, heavy hitting, nice solid sounds, adjustable screenshake for those who have sensitive eyes/want MOAR glory out of life; all the good stuff.- Over 50 weapons and about a bajillion combinations. Everything from shotguns to screwdrivers to laser miniguns and jackhammers. Yes, you can kill bosses with screwdrivers to rub it in if you want.- 10 unique characters, all with their own passive and active abilities. Have you ever wanted to dual-wield sledgehammers? This is the game for you. Each character totally changes the gameplay, and there will likely be one or two more released before the game is finished. Adds a ton of replay value, especially for the price, which IIRC will probably go down a bit when the game is released if you’re not into “beta” stuff. I highly recommend buying it now though, weekly auto-updates are a joy to behold and seeing the game change and grow so quickly is one of the coolest things ever.-This is -literally- the only game ever where, "aww crap I ate my laser pistol by mistake instead of my blade gun", is a valid complaint to make.. - Mutations! 21 of them and counting. Mutate new limbs and powers on the fly! This is one of the centerpieces of the game really, and it gives it a lot of strategy and depth without being too complex.. Should you play it safe with Rhino Skin and Rabbit Paw? Or go in all guns blazing with Laser Brain and Extra Legs? You decide!- Interact with the devs! The devs are awesome and actually listen to and interact with their community. They host open-chat livestreams every tuesday and thursday where you can see what game developing is all about behind the scenes. You could easily influence the development of the game if you have an idea they like!- Nuclear Crowns! These are like mutations, but they’re harder to get and change the game in more interesting ways. For example; the crown of guns replaces ammunition drops with MOAR GUNS. (This bit is still very WIP.)- One bazillion unique enemies and three spectacular bosses (and it’s still in beta!). Lots and lots of them, all ready to cause you rage/be blown backwards at ludicrous speeds. The polish on the enemies is amazing.- Incredible sound effects by Joonas Turner. Every shot is a war cry and every explosion is a burst of life. This game is ALIVE with sounds. Each mutant/enemy even has/will be getting their own voice-overs and sound effects.- Oh right. I forgot. THE BOSSES. They rule. Intense? You've never seen intense before. Pounding music, bullet hell, death, glory, spit and grit, it's all here. When's the last time you fought a rampaging mechanical dog the size of a dinosaur? I rest my case.- Amazing soundtrack by KOZILEK. Guitars, harmonicas, heavy synths, thumping bass. There I go again making lists... Long story short; I've listened to it for 50+ hours and still love it.- SECRETS! There’s already a secret area. Pure legit-ness on a stick. Golden weapons, B-skins, secret music, all of these round out the game nicely and keep you coming back for more.- Oh, and the soundtrack is FREE! (at least for now). Just go into the folder where the game is stored and you'll find a handful of mysterious .WAV files lying around. Yeah, that's right. You're welcome. *blasts airhorn*- Crunchy 8-bit pixel-art goodness by Paul Veer, one of the best pixel artists around. Smooth animation looks great, and the characters/enemies are all lively. Did you know that the shotgun-toting alligators smoke cigars and breathe the smoke out of their noses when not fighting? Look closely, it's there.- VERY minimal system requirements. I'm running this on a 5-year-old dell laptop with a Nvidia Quadro 160M graphics chip; solid 60fps.So, that about wraps up what I think! 2 crystallized thumbs and a robot leg up!If you’re still on the fence about getting it, I’d recommend getting the FREE Mojam prototype and precursor to this game, (Wasteland Kings), and giving it a try first! (keep in mind that Nuclear Throne is about 4-6 times better)You can give that for a spin, (as well as some other amazing FREE games), at http://vlambeer.com/3/ and http://store.vlambeer.com/Thanks for reading!(TL:DR, this game is amazepants and you should buy it NOW.)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								I first heard of this game a long while back when it went by a different name and desired to be "The Binding of Isaac with more skill-indexed gameplay". Or something like that. A good many months and a name change later, I feel as though they really nailed what they were going for. The shooting is solid, projectile deviation isn't too bad and a successful playthrough to completion isn't determined by lucky item drops but by your ability. But...what exactly is this game, you may ask?This is a top down shoot-em-up roguelike that features a cast of characters with their own gameplay quirks.They have their own abilities or traits that you have to (slightly) alter your playstyle to embrace, with some making the journey to the throne a good deal easier than others. You keep fightin' till you die and then you start over with randomized levels, items and all of your traits that you gained by leveling up gone.The difficulty of this game can be described as...definitely challenging, because it wastes no time in punishing you if you make a mistake. You don't have invulnerability frames (or any that I've noticed), so you'll get quickly melted down by machine gun fire, actual fire and hordes of melee enemies. If you're not dead outright, you'll definitely be close.Speaking of death and adapting your playstyle, one of the funner things you can do is play as the Chicken.When you die as her, her head pops off and she can run around for a little while still able to attack before finally actually dying. Combine this with the trait earned through leveling up that allows you to get health for killing enemies, and you have a way to potentially be unkillable (if you're lucky enough to have it activate on a constant basis).That is but one of the wacky things you can figure out to do in this little, action-packed gem.Which, I should add, is still in early access as of this review. I greatly look forward to see where this goes in terms of balance and content addition.Amazing score / 10, will definitely play again

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
Early Access Review
								I have to say that Nuclear Throne is a very fun game and has a nice challenge to it, but at certain parts it seems that the challenge/skill curve is very steep, and it is somewhat of a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥when the dungeons sometimes have enough XP to level you up, where as other playthroughs barely give you enough to get halfway to the next level. Apart from that, my only other complaint is that it could use a mechanic where Chicken is able to regain his head and the player gets like half health every time they die (in a level) rather than running around headless and hoping that God favors you and lets one of the mobs drop a health pack for you to revive with. All in all; an amazing game even this early on, can't wait to see what the finished product looks like and what new characters/elements the bring in.

												Now that the game's released, i can make a serious review.This is game is basically Touhou, except you move where you want, and play as a mutated anthropomorphic fish that is capable of rolling with a gun rather than a magical loli witch-thing, and fight other mutants (and a chair) to win instead of fighting other magical lolis. There's also no slow-down and your hitbox is as big as your character.This game is a LOT of fun, i've been playing it for a year and a half, and it's probably one of the most addictive games i've played to date. I absolutely recomend buying it.(Don't be fooled by how the game's supposedly "not early access anymore" tho, it still has a lot of bugs...)

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Once again Vlambeer creates one of the greatest Rogue-like games of all time! With over 100 weapons, 10+ mutations(upgrades) and , 10+ characters. This game has taken up most of my free time as it will yours. I got into this game by several Youbers including bisnap, Kakujo, Sleepcycles.     This game has procedurally generated level, weapons, and mutations. I has perma-death and unlockables. The looping system in this game is very complex. So don't expect to win in your first 10 hours.     As a semi-pro like myself many people are competitive and try to do the "dailies" , a seeded run in which you get only one chance to achieve glory on the leaderboards. The recently added dailies have preset characters, mutations, Crowns, and weapons.     2 of my friends have this game and seem to have taken a linking to it. I will tell you the story of my people. Blaghs blgggagh blasgghs. Thank you Fish for that demonstration. The wraps up my review for Plutonium Chair. 10/10 Vlambeer.

content:
Posted: February 20
												Nuclear Throne takes the "screwed over from terrain" elements of a rouge like and mixes that with very difficult gunplay (the good kind of difficult mind you) meaning you have to utalize every weapon you can find, pick your mutations (you level up from getting rads from defeating foes) carefully and think about which one is either the most beneficial or the least "I wasted leveling up" kinda thing (not that the mutations are bad, its just they are random, thus you need to pick the best you can by thinking carefully even tho the mutations that may be available may not be what you were hoping to grabLasltly you need to mae every round count unlike some twin sticks which hand out health packs and ammo frequently, you have to either get lucky or keep an eye out for chests, not to mention, the chests can "open you up" if you will by attackingThe game feels like a mix of the binding of issac, mixed with a schmup (can be overwhelming at times and very difficult, but isn't a bullet heck) and a twin stick shooter for obvious reasonsBut this is  an interesting concept  for a game(reminds me of a mixture of rampage (ie be a monster/mutant) mixed with the nuclear post apocalptic aspects of fallout in terms of the game on the "tip of the iceberg" if you willBut what keeps you coming back to play the game is that it's very quick to pick up and play (or throw down and rage quit, xd) while also being fun and giving you that "just one more run" kind of feeling if you get a game over, and with a cool cast of characters with their own individual traits and abilities (some characters were unexpected) and plenty of replay value, this game is a great game to pick up and who knows, maybe a Nuclear Throne 2 will come around?

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22
												Haven't completed a loop yet, but from how far I've gotten, I'm really liking it.I could be loving it if it weren't for a couple godawful design decisions, like the overhang on north-facing walls being a ♥♥♥♥ing whole tile long.Getting killed by an enemy hiding beneath a wall tile is always a great gameplay mechanic.Fan-♥♥♥♥ing-tastic design choice right there.That aside, the rest of the issues are quality-of-life or personal opinions — nothing too aggrevating.No locking cursor to the game window, so if you have two monitors you'll be clicking off the game once every while.  That being said, the game doesn't like to show up in the task bar, so you'll have to alt-tab back in.Also, the movement in the game feels odd to me.  It definitely feels like your character has momentum, and you skid just under a tile when stopping and such. I play a lot of Touhou, so I'm used to really crisp movement and being able to dart back and forth between bullets at any moment, so there have definitely been a few times where I've gotten caught by trying to dodge through bullets rather than retreating. And deaths where I kick myself for dying to "an easy pattern" that my brain says I should've gotten through, but the physics move differently than I intend.The hitboxes sometimes feel a bit off, but I'd attribute that to the movement more than anything for bullets.  That said, sometimes I could swear some melee weapons... Like I hit the enemy with the corner of the screwdriver's rhombus and it didn't take (A line not a rhombus?), or the tip of the wrench's arc.  As if the graphics are a bit bigger than the hitbox.Could all just be my perception, and that I'm trying to use my shmup skills too much and taking bad risks as a result.I've ranted too much.  Good game, pick it up.

content:
Posted: March 25
												if you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients- To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting - To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs, lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper- ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling.- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough.- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells.- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.- Roll the dough into two sheets- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.- Fill with the ravioli mixture.- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli.- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest - Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

												Nuclear Throne is a great game at its core, but the devs have abandoned it.I'd hold off until this is rectified.EDIT: I thought about this, and i figured that anyone reading this review deserves to know some of the bugs and gameplay issues i'm talking about.Besides several crashes, hangs and other issues, some major issues include:-Bugged crown vaults! Yknow, one of the most important features for changing gameplay experience?-did I say game hangs/crashes-IDPD rendering behind vans-More game hangs/crashes-Crashes right around 0-1-Boss music sticks around-Cursed ammo rendered behind wallsAnd the "bugfix" that brought its own problems for this was only released on Humble Bundle. It has been over a year (Edit, almost 2 now i think) since release, and leaving these bugs to be fixed by Yellow Afterlife in NTT is unexcusable, considering that vlambeer is still very active on social media.I get that they will not be adding new content, and that is fine, but leaving us with a flawed game is not.

												While I won't deny that I had fun when I first started playing this game, I'm still giving this game a negative rating because the lack of fun I had once I stopped advancing...In the end, I made it to the third boss once, after that, I've played the game for several more hours, but I wasn't able to get to him anymore. It's at that point that you start to get frustraded, as the only thing you do is keep dieing, trying to beat your previous progress.In my opinion, even though the presentation and music is very appealing to my personal taste, I think the core gameplay and some of the design decisions are not polished enough to make this the perfect 'bullet hell'/rogue game. That's why, if you really like a challenge, this might be the game for you. But for me, I just have too little time and too much of a backlog to try and beat this game...

content:
Posted: March 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is pure awesome! Despite being early on in development, unlike many other early release I haven't experienced any nasty bugs or crashes. The game itself is as others describe it "rogue-lite"; a fast paced and intuitive rogue-like game that is easy to play and easier to get addicted to. One of the tags very fittingly describes it as a 'procedural death labyrinth'; enemies, item drops and level layouts are somewhat randomized while still following a storylike theme as you delve through deserts, sewers and icy wastelands. Gamepad support is available, though not fully supported at the moment but nonetheless capable and fun. The artistic style is simply wonderful; nostalgic and beautiful in its simplicity. The best aspect is the various and colorful characters to play; each is rather wacky but presents varied play styles. All are great fun and are difficult in a number of ways. There are certainly things that are apparently lacking but these are easily overlooked in the face of its depth, fun and most importantly the promise at such an early stage. Don't waste your time! BUY THIS NOW! 7/10

Posted: August 17, 2016
												I give it 10/10.This game is so well done, the gameplay is high paced, the levels are randomly generated giving it so much replayability and the difficulty is pefectly extreme.The games art style looks great and the audio goes well with it. the game also runs very well (kind of expected from a game like this but still.)I love the enemies and bosses big dog is always gonna be the best imo because of his audio and attacks, lil hunter is a ♥♥♥♥♥ :)The fact that you can keep playing and playing even after beating the 'final boss' is also a very nice feature which allows for a nice ranking system.The achievments in this game are one of my most favourite parts because there actually hard to get and you feel like you have actually acheived something (unlike some games which give you acheivements for killing 10 enemies or playing the game for an hour).The characters are all special in there own way, also there just so cool (Y.V is my favourite).If you enjoy a challenge and/or bullet hell games with great ranking weekly challenges and great acheivements, I highly recommend you try this.Worth every penny!

content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								/!\ SPOILER ALERT/!\And a very big one at that.This is a great bullet hell, as it is already hard as soon as you spawn in! You are put into a series of randomly generated worlds that go from radioactive sewers to robotic tundras trying to get to a Nuclear Throne. It is quite unrelenting, only giving you 3 or 4 levels to get ammo and better weapons to fight bosses. It is a great time killer, as you think you'll do just one more run. Next thing you know, it's been several hours since you last said that. My personal favorite is the Robot, with the Crown of Haste. I always end up accidentally eating my best gun and then stuck in a really inclosed space with something like a bazooka. That's just me right...? Ok..just me then... Anyway, a great bullet hell, time waster, and there is a co-op button, so I have high-hopes that works out. I have high hopes for the creators of Nuclear Throne, and this is an easy 10/10 game in my opinion.                                     And remember, SHOOT STUFF UNTIL IT'S DEAD.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
												If the epic explosions and guns of Serious Sam and the artstyle/gameplay of Risk of Rain had a baby and that baby was exposed to Hiroshima's Radiation, then that baby would be dubbed Nuclear Throne. Nuclear Throne is a Bullet-Hell/Roguelike game that features many interesting characters, with different abilities, weapons, level and enemies that help/distract you from reaching the "Nuclear Throne" at the end of every game. You have to shoot your way through dungeons/maps that find ways of confusing you, so it's advised that you don't rush them. If you want a game that is packed full of challenges for your hand-eye co-ordination and reflexes, then I definetly believe you should play it. How it manages to tie such a simple genre into an interesting story is quite unique and makes you want to keep going back to play it, just so you can finally say you reached that Nuclear Throne! - 85/100.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												Now that the game's released, i can make a serious review.This is game is basically Touhou, except you move where you want, and play as a mutated anthropomorphic fish that is capable of rolling with a gun rather than a magical loli witch-thing, and fight other mutants (and a chair) to win instead of fighting other magical lolis. There's also no slow-down and your hitbox is as big as your character.This game is a LOT of fun, i've been playing it for a year and a half, and it's probably one of the most addictive games i've played to date. I absolutely recomend buying it.(Don't be fooled by how the game's supposedly "not early access anymore" tho, it still has a lot of bugs...)

								This game is pure awesome! Despite being early on in development, unlike many other early release I haven't experienced any nasty bugs or crashes. The game itself is as others describe it "rogue-lite"; a fast paced and intuitive rogue-like game that is easy to play and easier to get addicted to. One of the tags very fittingly describes it as a 'procedural death labyrinth'; enemies, item drops and level layouts are somewhat randomized while still following a storylike theme as you delve through deserts, sewers and icy wastelands. Gamepad support is available, though not fully supported at the moment but nonetheless capable and fun. The artistic style is simply wonderful; nostalgic and beautiful in its simplicity. The best aspect is the various and colorful characters to play; each is rather wacky but presents varied play styles. All are great fun and are difficult in a number of ways. There are certainly things that are apparently lacking but these are easily overlooked in the face of its depth, fun and most importantly the promise at such an early stage. Don't waste your time! number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								Nuclear Throne is a game wherein you play a one of many mutants in search of a thing called the Nuclear Throne, hoping it'll make life a bit less terrible for everyone if sat on. Although SOME things could use some tweaking here and there(finding the same gun five times in a row, tight passages being a bit weird to navigate sometimes) it's definitely already very enjoyable.You get TONS of different guns to choose from, and many mutations offer a boost to a specific gun type! The game also very realistically demonstrates the risks of actually attempting to use a saw disc launcher in battle. I would not recommend this unless you can turn into impenetrable stone. I hope they add more content, still a 10/10 :D
